At times FT has gone beyond scope of its power and ordered arrest, detention, revoked ration cards, etc. thus, troubling a poor Indian.

Conclusion: We should link Aadhaar card with the Voter ID
Premise: This linking can clear the path to internet voting or e-voting.

Conclusion: Indian government should increase the minimum legal age of marriage for girls from 18 to 21 years
Premise: As several girls are married at 18 years, they are not having financial independence. This is resulting in dependence on their husbands for survival. The dependence will force them to stay in the relationship even if it is abusive. So, raising the minimum legal age for marriage can empower women and can help them in achieving financial independence before marriage.

Conclusion: Hindi should be the national language of India
Premise: Almost half of India’s mother tongue is not Hindi. There are 22 officially recognized regional languages in India. Making a majoritarian language the national language is unconstitutional.

Conclusion: Hindi should be the National language of India
Premise: Some people are arguing that English is not born in India and hence we should avoid using it. This statement lacks logic because all the technological innovations we are now using were born in different parts of the world. We cannot reject things just because they are not Indian.

Conclusion: We should invest in R&D

Conclusion: We should promote the use of nuclear energy

The building process is slow, the price is high, no way, this could be a gain - if it weren't for the military.

Conclusion: We should improve migration policies

Conclusion: We should make living wages a human right

More supply means more jobs, more suppliers, lower costs, etc.

Conclusion: We should make pushbacks legal

Conclusion: We should return to the free market capitalist ideals in Europe and stop the advance of socialism and leftist ideology

Conclusion: We should reduce environment pollution by limiting number of people in Europe

Conclusion: We should promote a plant-based diet

Conclusion: We should promote mental health
Premise: A psychological examination should be part of child screening, together with counseling to parents (e.g. dealing with children’s own concerns and fears, or increasing self-confidence among children and parents). Conclusion: We should strengthen the public role of faith-based communities in environmental protection
Premise: A reflection on the future of Europe needs to identify and involve other actors alongside local and international institutions to fully deploy the founding values of our continent in addressing major global challenges.

Conclusion: We should recognize Esperanto as one of the cultural languages of EU citizens
Premise: Esperanto is a common language of citizens from all countries of the EU. Esperanto encounters bring them together for contact and understanding. The authorities of the European Union are called upon to support this direct communication of the citizens. It is our free choice in which language we want to talk to each other - please recognize and promote it!

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug offenses
Premise: We should legalize drugs as a means to promote justice, harm reduction, and religious freedom.  If we really want justice and human rights, this is absolutely essential.

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug offenses
Premise: Psychedelic medicines specifically have the potential to radically transform our mental health care.

Conclusion: We should legalize non-violent drug use
Premise: European institutions should take factual studies of the relative harm of different drugs into account. A UK study has shown that drugs such as cannabis and many hallucinogenic drugs are far less harmful than alcohol. The study in question was conducted by David J Nutt, Leslie A King, Lawrence D Phillips, on behalf of the Independent Scientific Committee on Drugs

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers and migrants

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration
Premise: Before Frontex is strengthened, Frontex's human rights violations must first be stopped.

Premise: Halting all immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries is shortsighted. We need to selectively pick people who can and are willing to contribute to the greater good like Australia and Canada and do prescreening instead of banning everyone.

Conclusion: We should ban the trading of virtual currencies.

Conclusion: We should protect our privacy in the Internet age.
Premise: The leaked personal information will be defrauded by fraud gangs to gain trust and carry out fraudulent activities.

Conclusion: We should prevent the disorderly expansion of capital.

Conclusion: We should vigorously develop the countryside.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.

Conclusion: Carbon emissions trading should be limited.
Premise: China's processing capacity is increasing, while carbon emissions are accelerating. The development of a low-carbon economy and the reshaping of the energy system have important security implications.
